30 // See: https://codereview.stackexchange.com/questions/225923/a-simple-stop-watch-which-i-want-to-extend
31 class Timer {
32 private:
33  using clock = std::chrono::steady_clock;
34 
35  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
38 
39  clock::time_point m_startTime = {};
40  clock::duration m_elapsedTime = {};
41 
43 public:
44  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
47 
49  template<typename Rep>
50  static Rep ToSeconds(const clock::duration& duration) {
51  return std::chrono::duration<Rep>(duration).count();
52  }
53  //template<typename Rep>
54  //static Rep ToMilliSeconds(const clock::duration& duration) {
55  // return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::duration<Rep, std::chrono::milliseconds>>(duration).count();
56  //}
57 
59  static Timer FromElapsedSeconds(float seconds);
60 
62  static std::time_t SteadyToTime_t(const clock::time_point& time);
63 
65  static GString ToString(const clock::time_point& time) {
66  return ToString(time, GString());
67  }
68  static GString ToString(const clock::time_point& time, const GString& format);
69 
71 
72  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
75 
76  Timer();
77  Timer(const Timer& other);
78  ~Timer();
79 
81 
82  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
85 
86  const clock::time_point& startTime() const {
87  return m_startTime;
88  }
89 
91 
92  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
95 
96  Timer& operator=(const Timer& other);
97 
99 
100  //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
103 
105  bool isRunning() const {
106  // Is running if start time is not a null time_point
107  return m_startTime != clock::time_point{};
108  }
109 
111  clock::duration restart() {
112  // Stop to cache elapsed time
113  stop();
114  clock::duration elapsedTime(m_elapsedTime);
115 
116  // Reset to clear elapsed time
117  reset();
118 
119  // Start clock again
120  start();
121 
122  return elapsedTime;
123  }
124 
126  void start() {
127  // Only start of not running
128  if (!isRunning()) {
129  m_startTime = clock::now();
130  }
131  }
132 
134  void stop() {
135  if (isRunning()) {
136  m_elapsedTime += clock::now() - m_startTime;
137  m_startTime = {};
138  }
139  }
140 
142  void reset() {
143  m_startTime = {};
144  m_elapsedTime = {};
145  }
146 
148  clock::duration getElapsedDuration() const {
149  auto result = m_elapsedTime;
150  if (isRunning()) {
151  result += clock::now() - m_startTime;
152  }
153  return result;
154  }
155 
157  // TODO: Pass in period, for units other than seconds (default)
158  // e.g., std::chrono::duration<Rep, std::milli> would return milliseconds
159  template<typename Rep>
160  Rep getElapsed() const {
161  return ToSeconds<Rep>(getElapsedDuration());
162  }
163 
165 };
166 
167 
169 } // End namespaces
170 
171 #endif
